abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Dominican Republic
            Health Sector Reform Project would be to support the
            Borrower in (i) improving access of the poor in Prioritized
            Regions and Provinces to high quality health services; (ii)
            reorganizing and strengthening health systems in Prioritized
            Regions to comply with the roles and functions as
            established in the General Health Law and the Social
            Security Law; (iii) strengthening the financial planning of
            the subsidized regime, ensuring the effective enrollment of
            the poor and improving their knowledge of their rights under
            family insurance; and (iv) strengthening the capacity of
            national health sector organizations to comply with their
            roles and functions as established in the General Health Law
            and the Social Security Law. The first component would
            finance activities that improve the access to high-quality
            health services in prioritized regions and provinces to meet
            the increasing demand of the enrolled poor. The second
            component would finance interventions to support the
            reorganization and strengthening of health systems in
            prioritized regions according to roles and functions defined
            in the General Health Law and Social Security Law. The third
            component would finance activities that ensure financial
            sustainability. The fourth component would finance
            activities that build the capacity of national public health
            sector agencies to comply with the roles and functions
            established in the General Health Law and the Social
            Security Law.
